tasks.description: Deliver high-quality, robust production code for a diverse array of projects
Contribute extensively to the creation of the Dolby.io JavaScript SDK
Develop and style interactive web applications for Dolby.io
Collaborate with other engineers to create new brands, design systems and websites for Dolby.io
Engineer and improve major features of the proprietary Mixer layout application
Developed, maintained and shipped production code for client websites
Integrated Lectra Fashion PLM into Adobe Creative Suite and Adobe Creative Cloud
Built and shipped test automation tools for Modaris (CAD Application)
Architected and implemented an Adobe Illustrator plug-in for exchanging graphical data with Kaledo Designer
Collaborated with other engineers to create a demo application using new Microsoft technologies: Kaledo Trend
Architected and shipped extensions for Windows Media Center
Prototyped, designed and built a command station for x-ray generators
Developed, maintained and shipped a desktop application used to drive x-ray generators

selectedProjects.name: Lybitos-Strava
selectedProjects.description: React Native application consuming Strava Rest APIs.

selectedProjects.name: Ultra-Buddy
selectedProjects.description: Progressive web application for trail runners.

about: Back in 1998, I decided to try my hand at creating desktop applications and tumbled head first into the rabbit hole of coding. Fast-forward to today, and I’ve had the privilege of building software for start-ups, small companies, and a huge corporations.

My main focus these days is building products and leading projects for our clients at Dolby.io. In my free time, I have also released web applications and libraries that cover everything you need to know for your next trail running race.
When I'm not at the computer, I'm usually road/trail running, hanging out with my wife and daughter or spending some time listening to music.

general.name: Thomas Gilbert
general.pickupLine: I build accessible, inclusive products and digital experiences for the web.
